title: World cannot get enough of BO: People celebrate Obama's legacy on President's Day : FYI, News - India Today
text:
FYI World cannot get enough of BO: People celebrate Obama's legacy on President's Day World and anti-Trumps came together to commemorate the former US President on the President's Day to express their contempt towards the current commander-in-chief. They wished each other a happy Obama Day on the occasion instead. IndiaToday.in | Written by: Mohak Gupta A + A - Original Photo: Reddit 
Every year's third Monday of February is a holiday to celebrate Washington's birthday. This time, people instead celebrated Obama and his legacy. 
Also in an attempt to publicly criticise the 45th President of the the United Sates of America, people on Twitter commemorated the former US President. 
On President's Day, thousands protested against Donald Trump across the US, and raised banners which read 'Not My President'. 
While Donald Trump wished the country a happy President's Day, people wished the former President Barack Obama a happy one and 'not their president'. HAPPY OBAMA DAY EVERYBODYâ�¤ï¸�â�¤ï¸� We love you Mr. President!! #ObamaDay pic.twitter.com/YlxIMIoQVU â€” Raquel (@KaiiStarr) February 20, 2017 â€” DKT (@darleneturner53) February 20, 2017 â€” Jordan Uhl (@JordanUhl) February 20, 2017 â€” Ebony (@hey_ebie) February 20, 2017 â€” I'm Every Woman (@ebpersons) February 20, 2017 â€” BowlingGreenSurvivor (@epaldelta) February 20, 2017 
Earlier this month, Illinois legislators even discussed making August 4, which is Obama's birthday, a state holiday.
